Profile.name: Teemu Tupola
Profile.title: Backend Developer
Profile.description:
I am a young software developer from Hämeenlinna, Finland, always curious and not afraid to ask questions! I am a third-year Business Information Technology student at HAMK.

I know the fundamentals of programming and I am eager to develop reliable and functional software solutions. I am especially interested in backend development, bug-fixing, and debugging, because they allow me to use my problem-solving skills and curiosity in the best possible way.
Profile.quote: "I learn best by doing – with a little touch of humor."

projects.title: AI-based Invoice Assistant
projects.description: I participated in the RUN-EU BIP Smart Everything course in Burgos, Spain, where international teams developed AI-based solutions for real business problems. Our project focused on invoice processing using artificial intelligence (AI Invoice Assistant / Finsum AI). The course included an intensive week in Burgos and a remote working phase. During the project, I was responsible for the user interface and integrating the large language model. The project used various frameworks and technologies, such as Python, Hugging Face, Streamlit and Astro.

media.alt: Image of the my team in Burgos

projects.title: Personal Portfolio
projects.description: The third and newest version of my personal portfolio. The different versions demonstrate my development over time, how I have learned new technologies and improved my implementation methods. The website showcases my skills, projects, and knowledge gained during my studies. Built with Next.js and styled to be responsive and clean.

media.alt: Screenshot of portfolio website in development
Screenshot of portfolio website in development

projects.title: React Native Application
projects.description: A school project where we created a React Native mobile application as a continuation of a movie review website. The app uses REST API endpoints implemented in the backend project to fetch movies and display them in a clear mobile user interface. Users can browse movies, view detailed information, and read reviews written by others.

projects.title: Software Testing
projects.description: Course final project where we practiced designing and implementing software testing using Robot Framework. During the project, we created automated tests for a website, focusing on validating UI functionality and key user flows. The work included test case creation, writing test scenarios, using keyword-based automation, running tests, and analyzing results.

projects.title: LejosEV3
projects.description: A school project where we programmed a Lejos EV3 Lego robot to follow a color-marked path on the floor and detect and avoid obstacles using sensors. In addition to robot programming, we implemented remote control functionality by creating a REST API that allowed the robot to be controlled through a web browser, enabling usage without physical interaction.

projects.title: Automation Robotics
projects.description: A school project where we implemented an automated invoice processing workflow using UiPath, Robot Framework and Python. UiPath read all PDF invoices, parsed header and row data, and saved them to CSV files. Robot Framework transferred the data into a database using SQL queries and updated processing status values. Python and Robot Framework were also used to validate invoice reference numbers, IBAN codes and sum correctness.

projects.title: Movie Review Website
projects.description: A React-based movie browsing and review website developed as a final project in the Backend course in spring 2025. The REST API fetches movie data from TheMovieDB API and stores it to a MongoDB database, from where it is displayed in the UI. Users can freely browse movies and, after logging in, also write reviews. The project was later continued in a Mobile Programming course by developing a React Native mobile application with the same functionality and mobile-optimized user interface.

LifeCareer.Info: I am a 22-year-old developer from Hämeenlinna, Finland, and my interest in technology has followed me since middle school. I have always wanted to understand how things work, and that curiosity eventually led me into software development. I graduated as an ICT technician from vocational school, spent a year in the army working with reconnaissance drones, and since then I have been building my path toward a career in software development. Traveling is also an important part of my life. Seeing new places and cultures has taught me openness and strengthened my motivation to take on new challenges. I believe these experiences have made me easy-going, approachable, and a collaborative team player who learns well with others. I am currently finishing my degree, and I am excited to see where my developer journey will lead next. My goal is to become a developer who builds clear and functional solutions while keeping a healthy dose of humor along the way.

Abilities.Info: My strengths include problem-solving, teamwork, and a strong desire to continuously learn. I perform best in a team where I can share ideas, learn from others, and build solutions collaboratively. I have worked in various types of projects and situations, which has improved my adaptability and flexibility in work environments.

Goals.Info: My goal is to grow as a software developer and learn something new in every project. I want to strengthen my backend and web development skills and gain a deeper understanding of software architecture, databases, and cloud environments. I aim to think more holistically, recognize real client needs, and build solutions that help both users and developers. I see my career as a long-term learning journey towards becoming a senior developer. I want to take responsibility, be a valuable teammate, improve my communication skills, and face new challenges with confidence. I am motivated by building something meaningful, functional and impactful.

Freetime.Info: In my free time, I enjoy doing much more than just sitting at a computer. Working outdoors in fields and forests and using a chainsaw have surprisingly become meaningful hobbies for me — they allow hands-on work and a peaceful connection with nature. I also love spending time with friends, whether it's being outside, gaming, or simply chatting.

Harrastukset.title: Programming
Harrastukset.Koodaus: Programming is both a hobby and a passion for me. I enjoy learning new languages and technologies and building meaningful projects.

Harrastukset.title: Disc Golf
Harrastukset.Frisbeegolf: I started disc golf in summer 2024 and quickly got hooked. I mostly play during the summer, either alone or with friends.

Harrastukset.title: Running
Harrastukset.Lenkkeily: Running helps me clear my head, get fresh air, and spend time with friends. It balances the screen-focused work and keeps life in good rhythm.

Harrastukset.title: Gaming
Harrastukset.Pelaaminen: I have played computer games for about nine years, mainly FPS games and F1 2025.
